intro: Sonchus cacaliifolius, commonly known as the largeleaf sowthistle, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, followed by small, spiky fruits that disperse seeds via the wind. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
